description.narrative: Benin Power Compact: This program targets poor electricity infrastructure, a binding constraint to economic growth in Benin, where the insufficient quantity and quality of electricity results in reduced productivity, output, and investment for businesses, less effective delivery of public and social services and diminished well-being and economic opportunity for households. This program will address these core problems through policy reforms and institutional strengthening, large-scale investments in energy generation and distribution infrastructure and off-grid electrification to expand access in a country where only one-third of the population has access to electricity.

title.narrative: Benin Power Compact Monitoring and Evaluation Plan
Benin Power Compact Key Performance Indicators

condition.narrative: MCA-Benin II has developed the FAP (or an interim version), and the plan has been approved by MCC. FAP accepted by MCC on August 3, 2016.

MCC has determined in its sole discretion that no material default or breach of any covenant, obligation or responsibility by the Government, MCA-Benin II or any Government entity has occurred and is continuing under the Compact, PIA or any other Supplemental Agreement, or under any systems, rules, policies, plans or guidance issued by MCA-Benin II or the Government (including CEB and SBEE) in fulfillment of any obligation set forth in the Compact or PIA (including any condition set forth in PIA Annex III. GoB is in compliance with the Tariff Plan. GOB is in compliance with Government Arrears Payment Plan. GOB annual budget provides sufficient resources for Selected Government Entities to pay their reasonably anticipated electricity bills. Unpaid GOB electricity bills incurred since Compact signing will not be more than 60 days past due. GOB will ensure that the annual budget provides sufficient resources for ARE. GOB prepares a gas policy. Continued compliance with installation of pre-paid meters covenant.
Prior to Disbursement of Program Funding after first anniversary of EIF, MCC and the Gov?t must have revised Annex III of the Compact.

Prior to ID for Program Funding, MCA-Benin II will have developed and adopted an environmental, social, health and safety management system (?ESHSMS?) (including a stakeholder engagement plan) in accordance with the MCC Environmental Guidelines (including the IFC Performance Standards that are incorporated by reference therein).

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding MCC has determined that the Gov?t has satisfied all of its payment obligations, including any insurance, indemnification, tax payments or other obligations, and contributed all resources required from it, under the Compact, the PIA and any other Supplemental Agreement.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCA-Benin II must deliver to MCC, a certificate of MCA-Benin II, dated as of the date of such Disbursement Request, substantially in the form provided by MCC.
Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCA-Benin II must deliver to MCC, a certificate of the Fiscal Agent, substantially in the form provided by MCC.
Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCA-Benin II must deliver to MCC, a certificate of the Procurement Agent, substantially in the form provided by MCC.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCA-Benin II must deliver to MCC, a completed Disbursement Request, together with the Periodic Reports covering the related Disbursement Period.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCA-Benin II must deliver to MCC, copies of any reports from any technical (including environmental) auditors engaged by MCA-Benin II for any Activity delivered since the previous Disbursement Request.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that MCA-Benin II has complied in all material respects with its obligations set forth PIA ?2.3 with respect to the establishment of an M&E Plan.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that MCA-Benin II has complied in all material respects with its obligations set forth in PIA ?2.1(d) with respect to the establishment of a Bid Challenge System.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that MCC does not have grounds for concluding that any matter certified to it in the related MCA Disbursement Certificate, Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate or Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate is not as certified.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that all Gov?t entities involved in the implementation of the Program, including the Implementing Entities, are coordinating successfully with MCA-Benin II and dedicating the necessary staff and other resources to ensure successful implementation of the Program.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that any Implementing Entity Agreements appropriate or necessary for MCA-Benin II to implement the Activities contemplated during the Disbursement Period have been executed and delivered to MCC and are in full force and effect.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that any Taxes paid with MCC Funding through the date 90 days prior to the start of the applicable Disbursement Period have been reimbursed by the Gov?t in full in accordance with ?2.8(c) of the Compact.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that each of the Officers remains engaged, or if a position is vacant, MCA-Benin II is actively engaged, to MCC?s satisfaction, in recruiting a replacement.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that no act, omission, condition, or event has occurred that would be the basis for MCC to suspend or terminate, in whole or in part, the Compact or MCC Funding in accordance with ?5.1 of the Compact.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that the Gov?t (including CEB and SBEE) or MCA-Benin II, as applicable, has made sufficient progress on implementing any systems, rules, policies, plans or guidance issued by the Gov?t or MCA-Benin II, as the case may be, in fulfillment of any obligation set forth in the Compact or the PIA (including any condition set forth in Annex III of the PIA).

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that the Gov?t has complied in all material respects with its obligations set forth in PIA ?2.13 with respect to the making of its contributions in accordance with the projected timeline set forth in Annex IV of the PIA.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that the Gov?t has obtained MCC?s written consent to any modification of any systems, rules, policies, plans or guidance issued by the Gov?t or MCA-Benin II, as the case may be, in fulfillment of any obligation set forth in the Compact or the PIA (including any condition set forth in Annex III).

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that the Implementation Plan Documents and FAP are current and updated and are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, and there has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the components of the Implementation Plan for any relevant Projects or Activities related to such Disbursement.
Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that the activities to be funded with such Disbursement will not violate any applicable law or regulation.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that there has been no material negative finding in any financial audit report delivered in accordance with the Compact and Audit Plan, for the prior two quarters (or such other period as the Audit Plan may require).

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that there has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the Gov?t?s implementation of the Master Plan and the Additional Sector Documents.

Prior to ID of Program Funding and each Disbursement of Program Funding, MCC has determined that there has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the M&E Plan and Social and Gender Integration Plan for the Program, relevant Project or Activity and substantial compliance with the requirements of the M&E Plan and Social and Gender Integration Plan (including the targets set forth therein and any applicable reporting requirements set forth therein for the relevant Disbursement Period).
Prior to ID of Program Funding, MCA-Benin II has developed a complete Implementation Plan.
Prior to ID of Program Funding, each of the Officers has been selected and engaged by MCA-Benin II and approved by MCC.
Prior to ID of Program Funding, the Compact must enter into force as provided in Article 7 of the Compact.

Prior to any Disbursement of Program Funding on or after the commencement of year 5 of the Compact Term, the Gov?t must submit to MCC, an initial draft of the Compact Closure Plan in accordance with the MCC Program Closure Guidelines.
Prior to second Disbursement of Program Funding, MCA-Benin II must develop and approve a comprehensive Social & Gender Integration Plan.

Prior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding for payment under a particular works or construction contract for a given Project or Activity, MCA-Benin II must submit to MCC evidence that MCA-Benin II or the appropriate Gov?t entity has developed and adopted, or validated, as the case may be, an environmental and social impact assessment (?ESIA?), an environmental and social management plan (?ESMP?), or a resettlement action plan (?RAP?) (as appropriate) with respect to such Project or Activity.
The Gov?t has adopted the Governing Documents necessary to ensure MCA-Benin II?s operation, and such Governing Documents are in full force and effect. Completed on Nov. 29, 2015.
